Rune Sentries.description: Arcs of lightning arc flash from the eyes of the floating sentries.
Rune Sentries.hazardDisable: @Check[arcana|dc:45] (legendary) to turn the lightning back against the sentry, causing the head to plummet, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th rank; counteract DC 36) to counteract the magic that empowers the sentry, causing it to plummet. Each sentry must be counteracted or destroyed separately.
Rune Sentries.hazardRoutine: (6 actions) Each Rune Sentry grants the hazard 1 action; a Rune Sentry that's plummeted or been disabled or destroyed reduces the hazard's available actions by 1. On the hazard's turn, all active Rune Sentries spend their action to use Lightning Arc.
Rune Sentries.name: Rune Sentries

Shattered Runewell of Pride.description: Plumes of magenta and violet light and vapor shift and writhe out of a hole in reality surrounded by the fragments of a runewell suspended mid-explosion.
Shattered Runewell of Pride.hazardDisable: @Check[arcana|dc:37] (master) or @Check[occultism|dc:40] (master) to redirect the magic back in on itself and cancel out the danger, or @Check[crafting|dc:40] (legendary) to reposition runewell fragments so they're not dangerous; three total successes are required to disable the shattered runewell
Shattered Runewell of Pride.hazardRoutine: (3 actions) When the shattered runewell takes its first action, a towering, 30-foot-tall image of Runelord Xanderghul formed from scintillating magenta and violet light and fire looms up from the runewell. On each of the hazard's three actions, this manifestation of Runelord Xanderghul scowls down at the PCs, and tendrils of strangely colored fire lash out of the runewell, each targeting a different PC in the area. The effects of these tendrils vary according to their color; these ranged Strikes can target anyone in the Eye of Arrogance and accrue multiple attack penalties normally.
Shattered Runewell of Pride.name: Shattered Runewell of Pride

Silent Devotee.description:
When the runelords first created the Emerald Chambers, an order of martial spellcasters was established to protect Xin's tomb. Known as the Silent Devotees, members of this order cut out their own eyes and tongues in a gesture intended both to prove their devotion and to ensure that knowledge of the Emerald Chambers would never spread beyond the order. After an initial surge of volunteers, interest in the order waned once the duplicitous nature of the runelords (and rumors of their involvement in Xin's assassination) came to light. Today, only a few dozen silent devotees remain.

The devotees expanded the scope of their mission after the runelords claimed portions of the Emerald Chambers for their personal use. These devotees fitted their empty eye sockets with emeralds magically imbued with the site plans for the Chambers, allowing them to patrol the extradimensional space in its entirety. Combined with the raw magic flowing through the Chambers, the emeralds turned the skin of the devotees a pallid green but also gifted them with a sort of immortality, such that the remaining devotees seem immune to the ravages of time. Today, the Silent Devotees are something more than the humans they once were.

Xin-Hndoros

The most devoted member of the Silent Devotees was surely Xin-Undoros, a loyal champion of Xin and one of the order's first volunteers. Though he predicted Earthfall, Xin-Undoros failed to warn the runelords of the catastrophe, blaming them for the death of his beloved emperor. As punishment for this treachery, Xin-Undoros became a graveknight shortly after the end came. While this transformation returned Xin-Undoros's ability to speak, he still refuses to do so, regarding such an act as a violation of his eternal oath.

6kRr0pEi6UAfzFib.description: 10 feet. The silent devotee is surrounded by an aura that suppresses sound, granting the silent devotee resistance to sonic energy and a bonus to all saves against auditory effects. Creatures within the aura can't use sonic attacks, use auditory actions, or Cast a Spell without the subtle trait.
6kRr0pEi6UAfzFib.name: Pall of Silence

CVquoqIULWmrpVk2.description: The silent devotee teleports to an unoccupied space within 30 feet.
CVquoqIULWmrpVk2.name: Transdimensional Step

Js1BeQMpKG6UgMXr.description: Though not undead, silent devotees don't age as most mortal creatures do. They don't eat, drink, sleep, or breathe.
Js1BeQMpKG6UgMXr.name: Untouched by Time

U6detunFxsigyWVV.description: The silent devotee marks a creature within 60 feet they can see with a rune of magical silence. The creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:34] saving throw or be affected as if by a 7th-rank silence spell. The rune lasts for 1 minute or until the devotee dies. A creature can be marked with only one Quieting Rune at a time. If the devotee uses this ability again, any previous Quieting Rune they've created ends.
U6detunFxsigyWVV.name: Quieting Rune

blCjYjNC45V8vqAJ.name: +2 Status to All Saves Vs. Auditory

x3FAkTAzjZHm1lqX.description: A silent devotee's Strikes deal and additional 2d6 precision damage to creatures that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} or are taking persistent bleed damage.
x3FAkTAzjZHm1lqX.name: Cruel Sneak Attack

Silent Devotee.name: Silent Devotee
Silent Devotee.npcAllSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. auditory

Slothful Stairs.description: A supernatural exhaustion fills creatures who climb the stairs.
Slothful Stairs.hazardDisable: @Check[athletics|dc:45] (legendary) to wedge crumbling stones into cracks to jam the collapsing stairs, @Check[thievery|dc:48] (master) to deface the hidden magical runes that power the trap; or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th rank, counteract DC 36) to counteract a rune; three total successes are required to disable the trap
Slothful Stairs.hazardReset: The trap continues taking Leaden Limbs actions (and the void at the bottom of the stairwell remains open) for as long as creatures remain in the area. Once no creatures remain, the stairwell rebuilds itself, the void closes, and the trap resets.
Slothful Stairs.hazardRoutine: (2 actions) The haunt uses Leaden Limbs once, then Crumbling Stairs once.
Slothful Stairs.name: Slothful Stairs

The Gullet.description: Images of excessive feasts decorate the walls of the hallway.
The Gullet.hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:43] (expert) to jam the hallway so it can't tilt; a character who succeeds at a @Check[acrobatics|dc:46] or @Check[athletics|dc:46] check can balance or sprint the length of the hallway before it has a chance to tilt. Flying creatures and Tiny creatures don't trigger the trap. Creative solutions (such as loading the hallway's western half with an appropriate counterweight) might also disable the trap.
The Gullet.hazardReset: Once the weight in the eastern end of the hallway is removed, the ramp rises back to its original position and the trap immediately resets.
The Gullet.name: The Gullet

nRiTUXo0Zl58DhvQ.description:
Frequency once per turn

Requirements The initiate's most recent action was to cast a non-cantrip spell

Effect The initiate siphons spell energy into their bec de corbin. Until the end of their turn, that weapon deals an extra 1d6 force damage and gains the arcane trait.
nRiTUXo0Zl58DhvQ.name: Bespell Strikes

nlA2lV1APcJAcClM.description:
Trigger A creature casts a spell the initiate has prepared

Effect The initiate expends a prepared spell to counter the triggering creature's casting of that same spell. The initiate loses their spell slot as if they had cast the triggering spell. The initiate then attempts to counteract the triggering spell.
nlA2lV1APcJAcClM.name: Counterspell

Trinity Star.description: A blazing comet with three tails—one red, one black, and one with rainbow hues—careens throughout the area.
Trinity Star.hazardDisable: @Check[athletics|dc:48] (legendary) to grab one of the comet's tails and rip it free; @Check[occultism|dc:45] or @Check[religion|dc:45] (master) to exorcise the divine energy of the red tail (which is infused with Gorum's legacy) or the black tail (infused with the nihilism of Abaddon's Eclipse); @Check[arcana|dc:45] (master) to unweave the magic of the rainbow tail (Xanderghul's mythic power); or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th rank; counteract DC 36) to counteract one of the tails. Each tail must be disabled separately to disable the hazard.
Trinity Star.hazardReset:
(1 action) The Trinity Star flies at a speed of 60 feet, moving through the spaces of as many creatures as possible. Each creature the Trinity Star moves through must make a @Check[reflex|dc:42] save with the following results.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[6d6[force]] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[11d6[force]] damage and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[22d6[force]] damage, is knocked prone, and if the creature is mythic, they lose 1 Mythic Point. If the Trinity Star has lost any of its tails, it regrows one of them (chosen at random if it's lost two tails).
Trinity Star.name: Trinity Star

Unspeakable Impressions.description: A trail of over-sized footprints crosses the path, markings of the apparently recent passage of a dangerous and mind-shattering entity whose stride is enough to be mistaken for depressions in the natural terrain, and promising destruction to those compelled to follow the tracks.
Unspeakable Impressions.hazardDisable: @Check[deception|dc:46] (master) to distract those (including yourself) compelled to follow footprints, or @Check[survival|dc:43] (legendary) to quickly obscure the trail
Unspeakable Impressions.hazardReset: The unspeakable impressions fade once they are triggered, but reform somewhere else in the vicinity 24 hours later unless they are successfully disabled.
Unspeakable Impressions.name: Unspeakable Impressions

Vesinra.description:
The brilliant and powerful lamia matriarchs possess boundless ambition, always seeking to bring more people and territory into the clutches of their kind. Consequently, they become rulers of other lamia. For all their cruelty toward other creatures, they're fierce protectors of other lamia, and consequently, they quickly come to rule cults or warbands. Regardless of the lamia's gender, these ascended lamias are always known as matriarchs. A lamia matriarch is set apart from their kindred by the occult power they pursue, and some have even had grand designs to break the animalistic curse that transformed them. However, every attempt so far has led to the matriarch's fall.

Lamias are bloodthirsty victims of an ancient curse for which they blame the gods. Most lamias are humanoid from the waist up but have the lower bodies of serpents. Sinister magic comes naturally to a lamia, and they prefer the use of illusions to deceive prey for later consumption, or simply to torture.

PycbJPVh46UXYc9R.description: Vesinra touches a creature, who must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:30] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}. If the target fails additional saves against this ability, the condition value increases by 2 (to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 4}). This condition value decreases by 1 every 24 hours.
PycbJPVh46UXYc9R.name: Vesinra's Caress

RHsGeVOoFFoGYyZ1.description:
The lamia matriarch can take on the appearance of a Medium humanoid. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage modifiers with their Strikes, but it does prevent them from using their cursed touch. Each lamia matriarch has a fixed humanoid form that resembles their upper torso when in their true form. This is the only humanoid form they can adopt using this ability.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

gdlB1R0JPorckEZC.description: Vesinra makes a falchion attack against each enemy within reach. Each attack counts toward her multiple attack penalty, but the penalty does not increase until after all the attacks. The first enemy she damages is subject to Vesinra's Caress.
gdlB1R0JPorckEZC.name: Falchion Swipe

Vesinra.name: Vesinra
Vesinra.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Vogorond.description:
Vogoronds are the remains of destroyed worlds imbued with the beliefs, hopes, and memories of that world's people. Their physical bodies often take the shape of monuments held dear by their worlds' former inhabitants, such as a statue of a beloved monarch. Vogoronds are intelligent and often seek to see their destroyed worlds reborn. Because their consciousnesses are formed from millions or even billions of individuals, however, they rarely possess the reasoning needed to pursue their desires to an end.

Reasoning With the Ruined Past

While a vogorond's memories aren't flawless, it knows more about its former world than any scholar could ever hope to learn. Often, a vogorond is the only remaining source of knowledge about the land it once inhabited. Theoretically, heroes from a world on the brink of destruction could travel forward in time to speak with a vogorond and learn what must be done to avert the apocalypse—an act which, paradoxically, would prevent the vogorond from being created in the first place.

PEkeJpnRu4YZJkkf.description: Each enemy in the vogorond's ruinous aura takes @Damage[8d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic] save).
PEkeJpnRu4YZJkkf.name: Debris Storm

UmjP1aHWQqM8kwpY.description: The vogorond's ruinous aura activates, extending to a range of 10 feet, and the vogorond can Fly once. The vogorond can Activate Aura as a free action when they roll initiative.
UmjP1aHWQqM8kwpY.name: Activate Aura

VyqAzMM90q3IIJwB.description: The vogorond deactivates their ruinous aura. Until the next time they act, the vogorond appears to be an inanimate statue, altar, or fragment of architecture. They have an automatic result of 45 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as such an object.
VyqAzMM90q3IIJwB.name: Monument

cwFzqYPKJx7z6LDG.description: A vogorond serves as a repository of the memories of the inhabitants of their home world. This gives them the Vogorond Lore skill, which they use when casting @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ZYoC630tNGutgbE0]{Hypercognition} and sifting through the combined memories of their countless shattered minds.
cwFzqYPKJx7z6LDG.name: Vogorond Lore

rl5JXpQOBFUkKsN4.description:
Requirements The vogorond's ruinous aura is active

Effect The vogorond launches a piece of rubble up to 100 feet. Upon impact, the rubble explodes in a @Template[type:burst|distance:20]. Any creatures in the area take @Damage[15d8[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic] save). The radius of the vogorond's aura then decreases by 10 feet. The vogorond can't Launch Rubble again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Launch Rubble]]{1d4 rounds}.
rl5JXpQOBFUkKsN4.name: Launch Rubble

uEHfJMSgbSJeUUuq.description: When a sleeping or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} creature wakes up within 20 feet of a vogorond, its memories are overwritten by those of an inhabitant of the vogorond's home world. The target is affected by a 9th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5BbU1V6wGSGbrmRD]{Never Mind} spell (@Check[will|dc:40] save).
uEHfJMSgbSJeUUuq.name: Dreams of the Past

xa1FtADL2YrI1QhO.description: 10 feet. The air surrounding the vogorond is filled with floating rubble and debris. This area is difficult terrain for creatures other than the vogorond. Each time the vogorond is subjected to a critical hit while their aura is active, the aura's radius increases by 10 feet. If the vogorond's ruinous aura would ever extend to more than 30 feet, the vogorond crumbles apart and is destroyed.
xa1FtADL2YrI1QhO.name: Ruinous Aura

Vogorond.name: Vogorond

Watcher in the Wastes.description: A massive sculpture of a wolflike form as tall as a mountain guards passage to the Cold Wastes at the northern end of Leng and seems almost ready to come to life at the approach of any creatures.
Watcher in the Wastes.hazardDisable: @Check[stealth|dc:51] (master) to avoid the initial notice of the gigantic form, or @Check[occultism|dc:48] (legendary) to know the proper posture and hand sign to make to turn away the watcher's attention
Watcher in the Wastes.name: Watcher in the Wastes

Zutha's Legacy.description: The scowling visage of Runelord Zutha appears above the altar. Meanwhile, mask-like versions of Zutha's face manifest on nearby rubble and vomit swarms of maggots. Once the masks are destroyed, the air fills with spectral duplicates of Zutha's life-draining bone scythe.
Zutha's Legacy.hazardDisable: @Check[occultism|dc:45] (legendary) or Religion (legendary) to exorcise Zutha's spirit, or @Check[intimidation|dc:48] (master) or @Check[performance|dc:48] (master) to recite the details of Zutha's defeat; six total successes are required to disable the haunt.
Zutha's Legacy.hazardReset: The haunt deactivates once no living creatures remain nearby. The haunt resets 1 hour later.
Zutha's Legacy.hazardRoutine: (4 actions) The haunt uses Vomit Maggot three times, then Poisonous Belch once. For each success at Disabling the haunt, the haunt loses one Vomit Maggot action. Destroying a mask also removes one of the haunt's Vomit Maggot actions. Once the haunt can no longer use Vomit Maggot, it immediately regains three actions and replaces Vomit Maggot with Spectral Scythe. Destroying a scythe also removes one of the haunt's Spectral Scythe actions. Once the haunt loses all three of its Spectral Scythe actions, the haunt is destroyed.
Zutha's Legacy.name: Zutha's Legacy
